definition: unhurried/calm/composed/leisurely
slow
strip/item/article/clause (of law or treaty)/classifier for long thin things (ribbon, river, road, trousers etc)
(phonetic)/this
Slovakia/Slovak/abbr. for 斯洛伐克[Si1 luo4 fa2 ke4]
texture/grain (of wood)/inner essence/intrinsic order/reason/logic/truth/science/natural science (esp. physics)/to manage/to pay attention to/to run (affairs)/to handle/to put in order/to tidy up

sentences.english: An easy tip for both seeming and being more self-confidence is to speak slowly.
sentences.chinese: 對於看似和實爲更自信的小訣竅就是要慢條斯理。

sentences.english: Hurstwood encountered Jessica in her dressing-room, very leisurely arranging her hair.
sentences.chinese: 在梳妝間裏她看到傑西卡還在慢條斯理地梳頭。

sentences.english: He always speaks slowly and acts unhurriedly.
sentences.chinese: 他說話做事總是慢條斯理的。
